metadata.title: CVE-2019-19768 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel 5.4.0-rc2, there is a use-after-free (read) in the__blk_add_trace function in kernel/trace/blktrace.c (which is used to fillout a blk_io_trace structure and place it in a per-cpu sub-buffer).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19768` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-51-generic - 5.3.0-51.44~18.04.2
linux-image-5.3.0-51-generic-lpae - 5.3.0-51.44~18.04.2
